conclusion: To solve the problem, analyze the velocity-time graphs of cars A and B to determine if their displacements are the same by calculating the area under each graph.

The image shows two velocity-time graphs labeled A and B. Graph A is a curve starting from the origin, increasing to a maximum velocity, and then decreasing back to the origin. Graph B is a curve starting from the origin, decreasing to a minimum velocity, and then increasing back to the origin. Both graphs are enclosed within a rectangle from t=0 to t=t1.
The displacement of an object is calculated by integrating its velocity over time. The area under the velocity-time graphs represents the displacement.

premise: Graph A starts and ends at the origin, forming a closed loop.
conclusion: The area under graph A is zero because the starting and ending points are the same.

premise: Graph B starts and ends at the origin, forming a closed loop.
conclusion: The area under graph B is zero for the same reason.

premise: Both graphs have zero area under them.
conclusion: The displacements of cars A and B are the same.

premise: Based on the analysis, the displacements are the same.
